Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that Facebook "censored" the image of Santa Claus kneeling before baby Jesus, when in reality, it was briefly covered with a warning screen.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that Facebook censored the image.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the warning screen placed on the image was deliberate censorship by Facebook, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the warning screen, such as automated systems mistakenly applying it or users flagging the image as offensive.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image was not deleted or blocked, and users could still view it by clicking on the warning screen.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
